meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, folks! It's time to review Cricket 24, the latest installment in the Big Ant Studios series. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, I had a blast playing this game (mostly), and I'll tell you why.

First off, let me just say that I love cricket. I mean, who doesn't? The strategy, the skill, the sheer excitement of watching two teams go toe-to-toe on the pitch. Okay, maybe not everyone loves it, but trust me, Cricket 24 does its best to convert newcomers into die-hard fans.

Now, let's get to the good stuff. The gameplay is where Cricket 24 truly shines. As a seasoned gamer (get it? Seasoned? Ahh, never mind), I found myself getting completely immersed in the game. The batting and bowling mechanics are spot on, with just the right amount of depth to keep things interesting. And don't even get me started on the graphics - oh boy, the graphics! They're a major step up from Cricket 22, with crisp, detailed visuals that bring the game to life.

But, as with any game, there are some drawbacks. I mean, where's the creativity? Where's the innovation? It feels like Big Ant Studios is just phoning it in this time around. Don't get me wrong, the little things they've added (like new licensed modes and franchises) are nice touches, but overall, Cricket 24 feels a bit... safe.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about the critics?" Well, let's take a look at what some of our esteemed colleagues had to say:

* IGN gave it a lukewarm 50 out of 100, saying it's a "bit too inconsistent overall to be considered an automatic selection."
* Digitally Downloaded praised the game's ball-to-ball action but felt that it still needs work in capturing the nuances of the sport.
* Push Square slammed Cricket 24 for being little more than a rehash of its predecessor with too many bugs and glitches.

So, what's my take on this? Well, I think Cricket 24 is a solid game that's worth playing - especially if you're a fan of the series. But don't go in expecting anything revolutionary or groundbreaking. It's just good ol' fashioned cricket fun.

That's it for me, folks! Hippo Penny out!
